instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  - 3 beeps
threads.message: Any idea why I might be getting 3 beeps on an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board. One beep when I pull RAM. 1.5V is on <SIGNAL>MEM_RESET_L</SIGNAL> and L7330. 0.75V line is present. CPU Vcore is giving me 1.15 volts like there is no RAM installed. Using known-good RAM in top slot only. I saw no sign of liquid-damage. Not sure what else I should be looking at.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  - 3 beeps
threads.message: Both slots same issue? Known good PC10600 RAM? Got a slot tester?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  - 3 beeps
threads.message: I feel great shame. I didn't try the bottom slot. It works. I've never witnessed a bad top slot only, only bad bottom slots. Still don't know why the top doesn't work but obviously this changes things a lot. Any ideas what could cause a top slot to not work? Visually, everything looks fine.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  - 3 beeps
threads.message: Who cares, max out the working slot with 8GB and be done with it.
